name: Syria
description: Syria, a nation steeped in ancient history and diverse landscapes, occupies a strategic position at the crossroads of the Middle East.  Once a cradle of civilization, it boasts a complex and often turbulent past, marked by empires, conflicts, and a rich cultural heritage. Today, Syria presents a challenging but resilient nation, striving for stability amidst ongoing humanitarian concerns and a slow, arduous recovery. Its geography ranges from the fertile plains of the Euphrates and Barada rivers to the rugged mountains of Lebanon and the arid deserts of the east.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The ancient capital of Syria, Damascus is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.
quickFacts.detail: Known as the 'Verdant City,' Damascus is renowned for its historic markets (Souks), stunning architecture, and vibrant cultural scene.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Syria's population is a diverse mix of ethnicities and religions.
quickFacts.detail: The demographic makeup includes Arabs, Kurds, Assyrians, and smaller communities of Armenians, Greeks, and Turks.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Syria's territory encompasses a variety of landscapes.
quickFacts.detail: It borders Lebanon to the west, Turkey to the north, Iraq to the east, Jordan to the south, and Israel to the southwest.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Modern Standard Arabic is the official language.
quickFacts.detail: Several regional dialects are also widely spoken.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Syrian Pound is currently experiencing significant devaluation.
quickFacts.detail: The economy is heavily influenced by the ongoing conflict.

climateData.title: Climate of Syria
climateData.description: Syria experiences a predominantly Mediterranean climate, characterized by hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. However, variations exist across the country due to altitude and proximity to the coast.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summers are intensely hot and dry, with temperatures frequently exceeding 40°C (104°F). Rainfall is minimal.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings a gradual cooling of temperatures and increased rainfall, particularly in the northern and coastal regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are mild, with average temperatures ranging from 5°C to 15°C (41°F to 59°F). Snowfall is common in the mountainous regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring is a beautiful season with blossoming flowers and pleasant temperatures. Rainfall increases steadily.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Hermon
naturalWonders.description: Mount Hermon, the highest peak in Syria and the Middle East, offers breathtaking views and a unique alpine environment. It's a significant religious site for both Christians and Muslims.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located on the border with Lebanon, Mount Hermon boasts a permanent snow cover during winter, creating a stunning contrast against the surrounding landscape. The mountain is home to diverse flora and fauna, including the rare Hermon snowfinch.
viewingTips: Bring warm clothing and sturdy boots.
Check weather conditions before heading out.

naturalWonders.name: Dead Sea
naturalWonders.description: The Dead Sea, bordering Jordan, is the lowest point on Earth's surface and renowned for its exceptionally high salt content, allowing visitors to float effortlessly.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Dead Sea is a unique hypersaline lake formed by the Jordan River's flow into the Syrian portion of the rift valley. Its mineral-rich waters are believed to have therapeutic properties. The surrounding landscape is characterized by salt flats and mud flats.
viewingTips: Avoid prolonged exposure to the sun.

naturalWonders.name: Al-Jazira Nature Reserve
naturalWonders.description: Al-Jazira Nature Reserve is a vital wetland area along the Euphrates River, supporting a rich diversity of birdlife and plant species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This reserve is a crucial stopover point for migratory birds traveling between Europe and Asia. The area is characterized by reed beds, marshes, and grasslands, providing a habitat for numerous species of waterfowl, raptors, and other wildlife.
viewingTips: Respect the wildlife and their habitat.

biodiversityCategory.name: Birds
biodiversityCategory.description: Syria is a significant migratory route for numerous bird species, making it a crucial location for avian biodiversity.

statistics.details: The Euphrates and Orontes valleys are particularly important for migratory birds.
Several bird species are found only in Syria.

notableSpecies.name: Syrian Warbler
notableSpecies.significance: A small, secretive warbler found only in Syria and a small part of Lebanon.

notableSpecies.name: Brown-necked Raven
notableSpecies.significance: A common scavenger found throughout Syria.

ecosystemData.title: Syrian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Syria's ecosystems are diverse, ranging from Mediterranean forests and grasslands to arid deserts and wetlands. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, but are increasingly threatened by human activities and climate change.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of Syrian territory is protected within national parks and reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Syria is home to a variety of mammals, including gazelles, wild boars, and leopards.

statistics.details: Several mammal species are threatened by habitat loss and poaching.

notableSpecies.name: Syrian Brown Bear
notableSpecies.significance: A rare bear species found in the mountainous regions of Syria.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Syria
activities.description: Syria offers a range of outdoor activities, from hiking and birdwatching to exploring ancient ruins and enjoying the natural beauty of its diverse landscapes.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Syria's stunning mountains, valleys, and forests on foot.

activities.name: Mount Hermon Hike
activities.description: A scenic hike to the summit of Mount Hermon, offering panoramic views.

activities.name: Al-Jazira Nature Reserve Trail
activities.description: A gentle walk through the wetlands of Al-Jazira Nature Reserve, perfect for birdwatching.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy swimming, boating, and other water activities in Syria's lakes and rivers.

activities.name: Dead Sea Floating
activities.description: Experience the unique sensation of floating effortlessly in the Dead Sea.
